text: 3.14 [E] Which of th; following matrices are necessarily orthogonal? (a) permutation matrices, which are obtained by permuting rows or columns of the iden- tity matrix, so that in each row and each column we still have precisely one value equal to 1; (b) symmetric positive definite matrices; (c) nonsingular matrices; (d) a product of two orthogonal matrices; (e) the sum of two orthogonal matrices; (f) matrices of the form aA, where a # 1 and A is an orthogonal matrix; (g) diagonal matrices.
